si.ijs.kt.clus.util.tools.optimization

Class GDAlg

  • java.lang.Object
    • si.ijs.kt.clus.util.tools.optimization.OptAlg
      • si.ijs.kt.clus.util.tools.optimization.GDAlg

  • public class GDAlg
extends OptAlg
    Class for gradient descent optimization.
    Author:
    Timo Aho

    • Constructor Detail

      • GDAlg

        public GDAlg(ClusStatManager stat_mgr,
             OptProbl.OptParam dataInformation,
             ClusRuleSet rset)
        Constructor for classification and regression optimization.
        Parameters:
        stat_mgr - Statistics
        dataInformation - The true values and predictions for the instances. These are used by OptimProbl. The optimization procedure is based on this data information. Warning: The parameter may be modified!

    • Method Detail

      • initGDForNewRunWithSamePredictions

        public void initGDForNewRunWithSamePredictions()
        Initialize GD optimization for new run with same predictions and true values This can be used if some parameters change. Thus we e.g. do not compute covariances again

      • optimize

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> optimize()
        Optimize the weights for the given data with gradient descent algorithm. This is the algorithm by Friedman, Popescu 2004
        Specified by:
        optimize in class OptAlg
        Returns:
        The weights for the base learners.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • putOscillatingWeightsToBan

        private void putOscillatingWeightsToBan(int iterationNb)
        Puts oscillating weights to ban, so that we can continue on the rest of weights. This is used only if for maxLoss combining something happens.

      • reduceStepSizeDueOscillation

        private void reduceStepSizeDueOscillation()
        Reduce the step size. Take the biggest needed reduction and do that

      • storeTheOscillationData

        private void storeTheOscillationData()
        A iteration has been done and oscillation not detected - store the previous changes

      • reversePreviousStep

        private void reversePreviousStep()
        Reverse previous (not this) step if oscillation found. Thus the state should be like it was before. This has to be called before storeTheOscillationData.

      • storeGradientsForOscillation

        private void storeGradientsForOscillation(int[] maxGradients)
        Stores the used gradients for oscillation detection later. Also initialization tasks for oscillation.

      • detectOscillation

        private boolean detectOscillation(int iiNewChange,
                                  double valueChange)
        Oscillation is detected if same dimension is changed such that the direction is different and the new step is bigger than previous.
        Parameters:
        iiNewChange - The index of MaxGradients/m_iNewDimension we are going on.
        valueChange - How much the weight is going to be changed
        Returns:
        If oscillation was detected.

      • OutputLog

        public void OutputLog(int iterNro,
                      java.io.PrintWriter wrt)
        Print the current weights output file.

      • getBestFitness

        public double getBestFitness()

      • postProcess

        public void postProcess(ClusRuleSet rset)
        Overrides:
        postProcess in class OptAlg
